commit_message:
Add support for HeadlessChrome in karma

Motivation for this change:
  As a tester, I want to execute npm unit tests in a headless
  chrome environment.

Notes on implementation:
  * Running headless chrome requires verion chrome 59 or greater[1]
  * --no-sandbox flag is a workaround for running as root[2]
  * HeadlessChrome base was added in karma-chrome-launcher v2.1.0[3]
    - upgrading to this package caused a CHROME_BIN not set error[4].
      Setting CHROME_BIN to chromium-browser fixes the issue.
  * Using Chrome without the upgraded packages causes an error during
    the coverage report generation
    - TypeError: Cannot read property 'start' of undefined[5]

[1] https://github.com/karma-runner/karma-chrome-launcher#available-browsers
[2] https://github.com/karma-runner/karma-chrome-launcher/issues/158
[3] https://github.com/karma-runner/karma-chrome-launcher/releases/tag/v2.1.0
[4] http://paste.openstack.org/show/715433/
[5] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/456556/9

Change-Id: I907708d73b5fe5345f3a56d8d638c51e7d3aa6f7

commit_message:
[WIP] Update npm packages

This commit updates npm packages because some packages are outdated and
it cannot run on the newest node version 7.

NOTE:
 https://www.npmjs.com/package/gulp-karma
 * gulp-karma has been deprecated. So we need to use Karma directly
 instead: https://github.com/karma-runner/gulp-karma

Change-Id: I26d9a6e33828fc9128c83725002c1200af200c77

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-21 16:14:10.000000000', 'message': "Utilise sorted to ensure no random changes

As part of the ceph-ansible project, this change was put in:
https://github.com/ceph/ceph-ansible/commit/ec042219e64a321fa67fce0384af76eeb238c645
This was to handle the case where the config would change, initiating a
restart handler, even though no actual change happened.

We can juse use sorted() since we are passing back a list with .items()
which can then be sorted.

The above change didn't include a change to ensure the order of the
sections, which meant that although the individual items were sorted the
sections could change order causing unnecessary changes.

Additionally, this adds a test to retemplate the file 3 times, with a
lot more sections to ensure the order remains the same, this will fail
when the config template changes even though no changes have happened.

Change-Id: I7c7cd9ef1dd767a2a5d754ac4663cf8655dd60c2
(cherry-picked from plugins repository)
"}, {'created': '2018-03-22 12:16:15.000000000', 'message': "Utilise sorted to ensure no random changes

commit_message:
Utilise sorted to ensure no random changes

As part of the ceph-ansible project, this change was put in:
https://github.com/ceph/ceph-ansible/commit/ec042219e64a321fa67fce0384af76eeb238c645
This was to handle the case where the config would change, initiating a
restart handler, even though no actual change happened.

We can juse use sorted() since we are passing back a list with .items()
which can then be sorted.

The above change didn't include a change to ensure the order of the
sections, which meant that although the individual items were sorted the
sections could change order causing unnecessary changes.

Additionally, this adds a test to retemplate the file 3 times, with a
lot more sections to ensure the order remains the same, this will fail
when the config template changes even though no changes have happened.

Change-Id: I7c7cd9ef1dd767a2a5d754ac4663cf8655dd60c2
(cherry-picked from plugins repository)

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I54f3f13093ce46778096ed0002fdc1e78e978e7c
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Remove the lacp bond mode constraints

As all the known issues have been fixed already in RHEL and ovs,
remove the constraint to avoid lacp bond mode configuration.
Closes-Bug: #1757382

Change-Id: Idaa871b46b7e9cd7a5d502f7865d946183f8d750
(cherry picked from commit 0077e8a8159db698e3709e3123d21b81622b4914)

commit_message:
[Docs] Simplify docs configuration

We don't need that many variables for the deployment guide, there
is barely any substitutions done. Simplify the documentation to
a bare minimum.

On top of this, we adapt for the latest openstackdocstheme.

Change-Id: I3502b6a943bacc6dac1b757961348eb04771750d

subject: Update unreachable links in election document
messages:
[{'account_id': 27190, 'date': '2018-02-13 01:01:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6088, 'date': '2018-02-13 01:55:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I consider historical platforms to be historical documents, which should reference content as of the time it was submitted.  If we make a mistake like failing to spell a person's name correctly, or similar, it makes sense to correct that.  If a candidate has grammar, spelling, or typography issues, it does not make sense to correct that.  If the links age, those investigating history may need to render contemporary historical documents to see that to which was referred in a position statement."}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-02-16 00:15:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

It isn't acceptable to update these documents"}, {'account_id': 27190, 'date': '2018-03-30 06:14:22.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Update invalid links'}]

commit_message:
make PowerVM capabilities explicit

Upcoming PowerVM driver changes will introduce support for some
capabilities. In preparation for those changes, this makes
capabilities explicit in the driver rather than inheriting defaults
from the parent class. This is consistent with other drivers.

Change-Id: Id42eed5e555c0dbedb220dcfcfd977b02a546156

commit_message:
[WIP] add external mariadb

Sometimes it is necessary to connect OpenStack services to an
existing Mariadb cluster instead of deploying it with Kolla,
this patch to add it.

Implements: blueprint external-mariadb-implement
Change-Id: Id367606894d9567ec54525bda2a96dd0c1e932da

commit_message:
Ingress: Give arbitary fqdns a different name from namespaced rules

This PS gives ingress rules attached to the cluster wide ingress
controller the suffix `-fqdn` to allow them to be used.

Change-Id: I7de85e349fb609b8380070030579b9b4767e72d1

Placement functional tests could, depending on run order, be unable
to synchronise the os-traits because a previous test or this test
has failed to reset the _TRAITS_SYNCED flag.

This change fixes it so the tests will always reset the flag at

to synchronise the os-traits because a previous test or this test

commit_message:
[placement] Fix bad management of _TRAITS_SYNCED flag

Placement functional tests could, depending on run order, be unable
to synchronise the os-traits because a previous test or this test
has failed to reset the _TRAITS_SYNCED flag.

This change fixes it so the tests will always reset the flag at
both setUp and tearDown.

In the process a nearby misleading comment which says a database is
not being used is corrected.

Change-Id: I595be7bca2c1bde86651b126ce501286b301d272
Closes-Bug: #1759863

Do we also need to move https://github.com/openstack/glance/blob/ca51cb84650da93c52a26b2581f0582f0a280c11/glance/tests/__init__.py#L30-L37 to be the first lines in the file?'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-03-29 20:22:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-29 19:57:46.000000000', 'message': 'Make eventlet monkey patching conform to best practices

Per [1], eventlet monkey patching should happen as early as
possible to avoid mismatches where a module was imported both before
and after it was monkey patched.  This is an exception to the import
order rules that should maybe be more explicitly called out.

In addition, partial monkey patching can be a problem, as shown in
the discussion of the thread module from the same document.  This
seems to be contributing to the doc build problems that are
occurring with the latest version of openstackdocstheme, so the
partial monkey patching is also removed in favor of full patching.

Change-Id: I0d2d9fb9f0b9d747ad1d955420f6ad129ebbfbcf

commit_message:
Make eventlet monkey patching conform to best practices

Per [1], eventlet monkey patching should happen as early as
possible to avoid mismatches where a module was imported both before
and after it was monkey patched.  This is an exception to the import
order rules that should maybe be more explicitly called out.

In addition, partial monkey patching can be a problem, as shown in
the discussion of the thread module from the same document.  This
seems to be contributing to the doc build problems that are
occurring with the latest version of openstackdocstheme, so the
partial monkey patching is also removed in favor of full patching.

Change-Id: I0d2d9fb9f0b9d747ad1d955420f6ad129ebbfbcf
1: http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-specs/specs/eventlet-best-practices.html#monkey-patching
Closes-Bug: 1759935

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-19 07:55:56.000000000', 'message': 'ovs-fw: Clear conntrack information before egress pipeline

In case where Neutron logical port is placed directly to hypervisor,
hypervisor does a conntrack lookup before packets reach OVS integration
bridge. This patch introduces a rule with high priority that is placed
at the beginning of the egress pipeline. This rule removes conntrack
information from all packets if conntrack information is present. Then
packets continue in the egress pipeline.

That means all packets in egress pipeline are not tracked and ovs
firewall can do a lookup in correct zone. As for ingress pipeline, it
distinguishes between tracked - which are packets coming from egress
pipeline, and not tracked, which are inbound packets coming not from a
local port.

Change-Id: Ia4f524adce2b5ee6d98d3921cfb03d56ad6d0813
Closes-bug: #1747082
(cherry picked from commit 3327db80be22650144342d1cc7e2c1b3e04a57ca)
'}, {'created': '2018-03-21 11:00:50.000000000', 'message': 'ovs-fw: Clear conntrack information before egress pipeline

at the beginning of the egress pipeline. This rule removes conntrack
information from all packets if conntrack information is present. Then
packets continue in the egress pipeline.

That means all packets in egress pipeline are not tracked and ovs
firewall can do a lookup in correct zone. As for ingress pipeline, it
distinguishes between tracked - which are packets coming from egress

Change-Id: Ia4f524adce2b5ee6d98d3921cfb03d56ad6d0813
Closes-bug: #1747082
(cherry picked from commit 3327db80be22650144342d1cc7e2c1b3e04a57ca)
'}]
commit_message:
ovs-fw: Clear conntrack information before egress pipeline

In case where Neutron logical port is placed directly to hypervisor,
hypervisor does a conntrack lookup before packets reach OVS integration
bridge. This patch introduces a rule with high priority that is placed
at the beginning of the egress pipeline. This rule removes conntrack
information from all packets if conntrack information is present. Then
packets continue in the egress pipeline.

That means all packets in egress pipeline are not tracked and ovs
firewall can do a lookup in correct zone. As for ingress pipeline, it
distinguishes between tracked - which are packets coming from egress
pipeline, and not tracked, which are inbound packets coming not from a
local port.

Change-Id: Ia4f524adce2b5ee6d98d3921cfb03d56ad6d0813
Closes-bug: #1747082
(cherry picked from commit 3327db80be22650144342d1cc7e2c1b3e04a57ca)

commit_message:
Break up fixup_stuff

Neutron functional tests want to use ubuntu cloud archive but it's
not possible to source the fixup_stuff.sh from a neutron CI setup
script. Break it up so that only the UCA portion can be executed
from neutron.

Change-Id: Ie18833bfa30f1789e63cbe9c86f5ece3453f43fb
(cherry picked from commit 4d835e33b6e901ef87023ce9b7d71bc21170a9e3)

commit_message:
Add Mistral to the provided controller roles

Mistral is not in the provided controller roles. Let's add that.

Pike does not have the MistralEventEngine
delete accidently MistralExecutor from the roles_data.yaml file.

Closes-Bug: #1694044
Change-Id: I8938fef87343d66cb216db364304ec7144ecaca6
(cherry picked from commit 5d81257224741ba5fd88439a92d4a0e0c192db06)

messages: [{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-03-29 17:31:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-03-29 17:37:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-03-29 18:13:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-03-29 19:10:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2\n\nLooks nice and easy.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-03-30 02:12:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-29 17:31:15.000000000', 'message': 'Allow a venv to be downloaded from a URL

In order to enable the ability to build venvs on a target,
then serve them via http(s) from a central storage host,
we enable the ability to set the path to be a URL. If this
is done then the venvs will be sourced from that URL when

commit_message:
Allow a venv to be downloaded from a URL

In order to enable the ability to build venvs on a target,
then serve them via http(s) from a central storage host,
we enable the ability to set the path to be a URL. If this
is done then the venvs will be sourced from that URL when
installing.

Change-Id: I166de361f568bfdf28c0f5d916ff8175827c45f4

commit_message:
Revert the use of wheel synchronizing

When using this role, a playbook can be used to orchestrate
doing all the builds on a single host. There is no need to
orchestrate this inside the role.

In order to gain the efficiencies of building everything on
a single host, a playbook can/should be used with the setting
'venv_reuse_build_only: yes'. Which will not continue to the
install stage.

Change-Id: Ib6e13ca7623942f8b0663b54528599b56b05fb19

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-29 21:55:40.000000000', 'message': "Use ksa session for cinder microversion check

[1] added a method to validate availability of a desired version of the
cinder API.  This method called into
cinderclient.client.get_highest_client_server_version to
(unsurprisingly) discover the highest available version to compare
against.  However, that routine uses a raw requests.get to access the
version document from the server.  This breaks when the endpoint URL is
using HTTPS, because nothing sets up the cert info for that call.

With this change, we work around the issue by duplicating the logic from
get_highest_client_server_version, but doing the version discovery via
the same keystoneauth1 session that's configured for use with the client
itself, thus inheriting any SSL configuration as appropriate.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/469579/

Change-Id: I4de355195281009a5979710d7f14ae8ea11d10e0
Closes-Bug: #1752152
(cherry picked from commit 20eaaee2334957eb8739ecca524a1c4aa9f246e9)
"}]
commit_message:
Use ksa session for cinder microversion check

[1] added a method to validate availability of a desired version of the
cinder API.  This method called into
cinderclient.client.get_highest_client_server_version to
(unsurprisingly) discover the highest available version to compare
against.  However, that routine uses a raw requests.get to access the
version document from the server.  This breaks when the endpoint URL is
using HTTPS, because nothing sets up the cert info for that call.

With this change, we work around the issue by duplicating the logic from
get_highest_client_server_version, but doing the version discovery via
the same keystoneauth1 session that's configured for use with the client
itself, thus inheriting any SSL configuration as appropriate.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/469579/

Change-Id: I4de355195281009a5979710d7f14ae8ea11d10e0
Closes-Bug: #1752152
(cherry picked from commit 20eaaee2334957eb8739ecca524a1c4aa9f246e9)

commit_message:
add check before adding cpus to cpuset_reserved

There are some cases where None value is set to cpuset_reserved in
InstanceNUMATopology at _numa_fit_instance_cell() function in
hardware.py. However, libvirt driver treat cpuset_reserved value
as an iterate object when it constructs xml configuration.

To avoid a risk to get an error in libvirt driver, this patch adds
a check to see if the value is not None before adding the cpus
for emulator threads.

Change-Id: Iab3d950c4f4138118ac6a9fd98407eaadcb24d9e
Closes-Bug: #1746674
(cherry picked from commit 24d9e06ec68dfd0ead9bc56ad186e7b4e0acd8fb)
(cherry picked from commit 2dc4d7a366efe11acb1099eca13bd3f3c2af9012)

[{'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-03-28 16:50:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-03-28 19:09:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

keytone tests passed'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-03-28 20:37:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-03-29 00:03:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I'd like to see a plan before we approve this.

Specifically how are we going to introduce newer versions of pysaml2 with paramiko etc.

In itself this doesn't enough for the check pipeline to tell us anything.  You need to bump u-c as well. to really see what happens to keystone, and all projects will need to work with old and new pysaml2s"}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-03-29 03:15:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

tony, the first patchset uncapped, raised uc and raised gr.  that was depended on https://review.openstack.org/557440/ which passed.  Keystone is the only project depending on pysaml2 as well (looking at http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=pysaml2&i=nope&files=.*requirements.*&repos= ).'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-03-29 04:05:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> tony, the first patchset uncapped, raised uc and raised gr.  that
 > was depended on https://review.openstack.org/557440/ which passed. 
 > Keystone is the only project depending on pysaml2 as well (looking
 > at http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=pysaml2&i=nope&files=.*requirements.*&repos=
 > ).

Yes only keystone uses pysaml2, but the reason we blocked 4.0.3 was because *it* installed pycrytodome which as you know installs into the same namespace as pycrypto meaning that we now have non-deterministic behaviour, constraints saves us somewhat.

We know all versions between 4.0.2 and 4.5.0 are bad so we need to make sure we bypass them.

Ideally wed block them in g-r but we can rely on constraints so we can just remove the cap in g-r and set u-c ===4.5.0 then if things go pear shaped we have a single change to revert. and then in say 2 weeks bump in the minimum here and in keystone.

In you commit message you imply we have to remove the cap in one change before we can bump u-c if that's true I'd like to know why

The plan is much more straight forward given that pysaml2 has made the switch to cryptography but nothing in this review explains *any* of that."}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-03-29 04:36:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

the uncapping and raising of gr/uc needs to happen in two stages because we fail keystone/grenade tests if we raise the uc in this review (see the earlier failure).  We could include masking for the following releases in this review if that helps though.

pysaml2-4.0.3.tar.gz
pysaml2-4.0.4.tar.gz
pysaml2-4.0.5.tar.gz
pysaml2-4.0.5rc1.tar.gz
pysaml2-4.1.0.tar.gz
pysaml2-4.2.0.tar.gz
pysaml2-4.3.0.tar.gz
pysaml2-4.4.0.tar.gz'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-03-29 05:09:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Okay I see:

  pkg_resources.ContextualVersionConflict: (pysaml2 4.5.0 (/home/zuul/src/git.openstack.org/openstack/keystone/.tox/py27/lib/python2.7/site-packages), Requirement.parse('pysaml2<4.0.3,>=4.0.2'), set(['keystone']))

in http://logs.openstack.org/34/557434/1/check/cross-keystone-py27/75e8076/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-03-28_16_59_24_984089

As an aside why are the keystone error logs missing from devstack jobs?

So put those details in the commit message we're good.

Given you're re spinning then I think it's best to add the exclusions at the same time."}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-03-29 05:12:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

ok, I don't think I'll bump the minimum in the second phase though (since 4.0.2 and 4.5.0 both seem to work)"}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-03-29 05:15:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-03-29 05:16:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-03-29 08:04:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Published edit on patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-03-29 08:05:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

PS3 Failed with:

 -pysaml2>=4.0.2,!=4.0.3,!=4.0.4,!=4.0.5rc1,!=4.0.5,!=4.1.0,!=4.2.0,!=4.3.0,!=4.4.0  # Apache-2.0
 +pysaml2>=4.0.2,!=4.0.3,!=4.0.4,!=4.0.5,!=4.0.5rc1,!=4.1.0,!=4.2.0,!=4.3.0,!=4.4.0  # Apache-2.0

Our sorting is wrong but meh'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-03-29 08:05:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-03-29 14:05:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

It looks like it doesn't like rc1 either, which makes sense for specifiers we care about (not exclusions), but doesn't make sense for exclusions."}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-03-29 14:34:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-03-29 14:37:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-03-29 20:11:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2018-03-29 21:15:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-03-29 22:45:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

commit_message:
uncap pysaml2

This is the first step in updating pysaml2 to 4.5.0.
Only keystone needs to consume this before we update UC/GR (as they get a
pkg_resources.ContextualVersionConflict if we update everything in one go).

The versions were masked because they could bring in pycryptodome, which we do
not want.

Next step, after keystone consumes this change, is to update upper-constraints.

We also want to be able to exclude prereleases if needed, so modify the check
to allow exclusions of prereleases.

Partial-Bug: #1750843
Change-Id: I6cf9812deecbfaea5ff6e47ba3d48dd94db773b5

commit_message:
DVR: Fix mac format for backward compatibility with vsctl api

Fix the mac address format for backward compatibility with
vsctl ovs api

Closes-Bug: #1756406
Change-Id: I3ba11fae433b437d9d3a0b12dd8a11fe1b35046a
(cherry picked from commit 6b13cf0bee67e6196201e7863b1facce54b6d6f6)

Unity: Enable ssl verification

This commit allow user to enable ssl verification on demand for the
Unity Cinder driver.

subject: base-test: Run emit-job-header on any host, but localhost
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-29 23:51:21.000000000', 'message': "base-test: Run emit-job-header on any host, but localhost

Because we want to add nodepool variables to the output of
emit-job-header, it doesn't make sense to run this role only on
localhost.  The zuul-executor host wouldn't have nodepool variables
defined.

Instead, pick a node from inventory and run the role there.

Change-Id: I1a609e04f6a15e936effbf08c50fd912590577b1
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
base-test: Run emit-job-header on any host, but localhost

Because we want to add nodepool variables to the output of
emit-job-header, it doesn't make sense to run this role only on
localhost.  The zuul-executor host wouldn't have nodepool variables
defined.

Instead, pick a node from inventory and run the role there.

Change-Id: I1a609e04f6a15e936effbf08c50fd912590577b1
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
change python-libguestfs to python-guestfs for ubuntu

python-libguestfs is for centos,
python-guestfs is for ubuntu.

Change-Id: Iec50b8c00db70386552dc4836b093f06c30baea7
Closes-Bug: #1751681
(cherry picked from commit 4b161d0026eefad756309eb6f43ba66f3ab634b8)

[{'created': '2018-03-27 22:50:58.000000000', 'message': 'Update heat bootstrap scripts

commit_message:
Update heat bootstrap scripts

This patch set adds in two roles for heat: heat_stack_owner
and heat_stack_user as outlined in the Newton [0] and Ocata [1],
as well as assigning roles.

[0] https://docs.openstack.org/project-install-guide/orchestration/newton/install-ubuntu.html
[1] https://docs.openstack.org/project-install-guide/orchestration/ocata/install-ubuntu.html

Change-Id: I8510ae114448cc1985c11e9b337b9697a379a920
Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>
Co-Authored-By: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>

commit_message:
Follow the new PTI for document build

For compliance with the Project Testing Interface as described in:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-December/125710.html

Remove [build_sphinx] section as described in:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128594.html

Change-Id: Ief4342133f5b2f094feb9816f154c6d17a2d028e

commit_message:
use http code constant instead of int

To keep the consistency, using http_client.ACCEPTED instead
of 202 and using http_client.PARTIAL_CONTENT instead of 206

Change-Id: Ia95e9174172621c843cc3d5078a21be65049e348

commit_message:
Introduce container status 'Restarting'

Docker container has the 'Restarting' state so we'd better to
introduce a corresponding status in Zun for mapping. This status
implies that the container is restarting.

Change-Id: I7718341fa8da1318f405735ab34009d88a8ef89a

uhmm..
I dont think so. Probably you need to write a spec first:  https://review.openstack.org/#/q/project:openstack/tacker-specs
Because this feature could impact to many parts in Tacker like Tosca template.

One vnffg can have several port chains. commit_message:
setup the virt-bmc in tq

The virt-bmc should be setup as part of the infra
steps in tripleo-quickstart not after the
undercloud install

Closes-Bug: #1756935
Depends-On: I5f5a3144e5f3f6b81acbddf2dfafb3b6b63a3833

commit_message:
remove virt-bmc setup for tqe

Setup the virt-bmc in tq prior to the undercloud install.
This should be done as part of the infra setup in tq

Related-Bug: #1756935
Change-Id: I5f5a3144e5f3f6b81acbddf2dfafb3b6b63a3833

[{'created': '2018-03-19 10:05:54.000000000', 'message': 'docs: Disable smartquotes

This change should then allow all configuration examples to be copied
from the docs directly into nova.conf without resulting in Unicode
errors when these options are then parsed.

Note that this option is deprecated and replaced in Sphinx 1.6.6 [1] by
the smartquotes configurable. A future change will need to land to
switch between these, for now we will use and backport the
html_use_smartypants option.

[1] http://www.sphinx-doc.org/en/stable/config.html#confval-smartquotes

Change-Id: I6c47a0d74e5b5a03bc030a7e45cc7783f22ddadf
Closes-bug: #1755783
(cherry picked from commit 75fc30090133c31316e6ae790568f1b622807d0c)
'}]
commit_message:
docs: Disable smartquotes

This change should then allow all configuration examples to be copied
from the docs directly into nova.conf without resulting in Unicode
errors when these options are then parsed.

Note that this option is deprecated and replaced in Sphinx 1.6.6 [1] by
the smartquotes configurable. A future change will need to land to
switch between these, for now we will use and backport the
html_use_smartypants option.

[1] http://www.sphinx-doc.org/en/stable/config.html#confval-smartquotes

Change-Id: I6c47a0d74e5b5a03bc030a7e45cc7783f22ddadf
Closes-bug: #1755783
(cherry picked from commit 75fc30090133c31316e6ae790568f1b622807d0c)

This removes the systemd service templates and tasks from this role and
leverages a common systemd service role instead. This change removes a
lot of code duplication across all roles all without sacrificing features
or functionality. The intention of this change is to ensure uniformity and

commit_message:
Convert role to use a common systemd service role

This removes the systemd service templates and tasks from this role and
leverages a common systemd service role instead. This change removes a
lot of code duplication across all roles all without sacrificing features
or functionality. The intention of this change is to ensure uniformity and
reduce the maintenance burden on the community when sweeping changes are
needed.

Change-Id: I128bc9736c1a460c161314eeaa6759de5ceba977
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Deploy container-multinode (fs010) with a containerized undercloud

We'll also switch featureset001 (ovb-ha) for the next job.

Change-Id: I942b48ef2fd4813ad2fdc5bae6694485de222ab5

[{'created': '2018-03-06 20:18:10.000000000', 'message': 'Remove default value for pacmaker passwords

The default values for the PcsdPassword and PacemakerRemoteAuthkey
parameters have been removed, as they did not result in a functioning
pacemaker installation. These values are instead generated by
tripleo-common, and in the cases where they are not (direct API), we
want to fail explicitly if they are not provided.

Change-Id: I37f7a30e593263da2c18d1b2dad89e780a172a51
Closes-Bug: #1753822
'}]
commit_message:
Remove default value for pacmaker passwords

The default values for the PcsdPassword and PacemakerRemoteAuthkey
parameters have been removed, as they did not result in a functioning
pacemaker installation. These values are instead generated by
tripleo-common, and in the cases where they are not (direct API), we
want to fail explicitly if they are not provided.

Change-Id: I37f7a30e593263da2c18d1b2dad89e780a172a51
Closes-Bug: #1753822

subject: Fix misspelled registered variable name in conditional
messages: [{'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-03-29 18:44:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch stable/pike.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-03-29 18:45:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11069, 'date': '2018-03-29 19:59:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7414, 'date': '2018-03-29 23:07:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-29 18:44:45.000000000', 'message': 'Fix misspelled registered variable name in conditional

add_uca_repo -> uca_add_repo

Commit c68db4e6 refactored a task into two tasks and in the process
misspelled the variable registered in the first task within the
condition of the second task.  The undefined state of the misspelled
variable was unintentionally handled in this case because under
different circumstances the variable is expected to be undefined (ie
when the first task is skipped).

Change-Id: I73b7c5ab4de50df0b341fc3c02675e6c23b2b3da
Signed-off-by: Corey Wright <corey.wright@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 9195bc70667efafbbe9189cec505e03da4e31c49)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix misspelled registered variable name in conditional

add_uca_repo -> uca_add_repo

Commit c68db4e6 refactored a task into two tasks and in the process
misspelled the variable registered in the first task within the
condition of the second task.  The undefined state of the misspelled
variable was unintentionally handled in this case because under
different circumstances the variable is expected to be undefined (ie
when the first task is skipped).

Change-Id: I73b7c5ab4de50df0b341fc3c02675e6c23b2b3da
Signed-off-by: Corey Wright <corey.wright@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 9195bc70667efafbbe9189cec505e03da4e31c49)

network.

commit_message:
update for changes needed to pass refstack v2

This is prevents us from uploading the same image list twice when we
really only need to upload two images, so just redefine the image in the
list to get it to upload a second one.

Change-Id: Ia4c4510ee2e870f599702e1c142d0563f2ad57dc

commit_message:
Promote new ara-report role and ARA middleware to base job

The ara-report role and the ARA middleware have individually been
tested and are ready for production use.

See related patches [1] for details.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/q/topic:ara-sqlite-middleware

Change-Id: I2d9bf386f4454193bad0caa7569e9b3ff1cf2f87

commit_message:
Avoid tox-install.sh

Instead of using tox-install.sh, we can install horizon and neutron
now directly from pypi - or use the current branch in CI system using
tox-siblings.

Update tox.ini for this change and add horizon to requirements file.

Change-Id: I0e2986d2fe06d07b5c08d73ac7f13fc3778eccc3

commit_message:
Contanerized Undercloud - Routed Spine-Leaf

* Update config to use the same options used in
  instack-undercloud for routed ctlplane network.
* Update pre-flight validations to validate all
  the networks. (Also fix and re-enabled validations
  that was disabled)
* Create input for OS::TripleO::Services::MasqueradeNetworks

Depends-On: Ide1267bfd9cc60d837dc823e4e106ac70dd2e5e6
Change-Id: I5fbac0c4a75ad2fb719bfd10887778c8eaeacfd6

commit_message:
Added the missing attributes for roles_data of ovs-dpdk-agent docker service

Missing attributes docker_config_scripts and update_tasks are added in the
neutron-ovs-dpdk-agent docker service.
Closes-Bug: #1757947

Change-Id: I7301eb7a2b094236c7caad38996a4c3983f22603
(cherry picked from commit f18ca897eda156fc2cadc300db677e6129ddbfad)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-30 20:39:05.000000000', 'message': 'Support SshKnownHostsDeployment with config-download

Add support for the SshKnownHostsDeployment resources to
config-download. Since the deployment resources relied on Heat outputs,
they were not supported with the default handling from tripleo-common
that relies on the group_vars mechanism.

Instead, this patch refactors the templates to add the known hosts
entries as global_vars to deploy_steps_playbook.yaml, and then includes
the new tripleo-ssh-known-hosts role from tripleo-common to apply the
same configuration that the Heat deployment did.

Since these deployments no longer need to be triggered when including
config-download-environment.yaml, a mapping is added that can be
overridden to OS::Heat::None to disable the deployment resources when
using config-download.

The default behavior when not using config-download remains unchanged.

Closes-Bug: #1746336
Depends-On: I9314596f9ab48e95ba34d08dba9abfee2f8d2e0c
Change-Id: Ia334fe6adc9a8ab228f75cb1d0c441c1344e2bd9
'}, {'created': '2018-01-30 20:42:44.000000000', 'message': 'Support SshKnownHostsDeployment with config-download

commit_message:
Support SshKnownHostsDeployment with config-download

Add support for the SshKnownHostsDeployment resources to
config-download. Since the deployment resources relied on Heat outputs,
they were not supported with the default handling from tripleo-common
that relies on the group_vars mechanism.

Instead, this patch refactors the templates to add the known hosts
entries as global_vars to deploy_steps_playbook.yaml, and then includes
the new tripleo-ssh-known-hosts role from tripleo-common to apply the
same configuration that the Heat deployment did.

Since these deployments no longer need to be triggered when including
config-download-environment.yaml, a mapping is added that can be
overridden to OS::Heat::None to disable the deployment resources when
using config-download.

The default behavior when not using config-download remains unchanged.

Closes-Bug: #1746336
Change-Id: Ia334fe6adc9a8ab228f75cb1d0c441c1344e2bd9

commit_message:
Update pypowervm min to 1.1.13

1.1.13 is required for a proposed PowerVM virt driver change [1].
The previous lower bound was also insufficient for another
proposed change [2] that requires at least 1.1.12.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/555309/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/552172/

Change-Id: I7f303a8e91460e9396cf6454e700c51e934fb151

commit_message:
Promote ara-report role and ARA middleware to base-[minimal,test]

The ara-report role and the ARA middleware have individually been
tested and feel ready for production use, let's formally use them
for base-minimal and base-test before promoting to base.

See related patches [1] for details.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/q/topic:ara-sqlite-middleware

Change-Id: I9c95d035f91f2e3a76cf11d6f5ef54b3f0892363

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-16 13:40:57.000000000', 'message': 'synchronize default vpc creation across threads

when two clients come for functions where check_default_vpc
is present then one goes to create default vpc and other fails.
it fails because vpc with is_default flag is already in DB
but children objects (like subnets) are not yet created.
For we will lock check_default_vpc function.

Another way is to rework _create_vpc. It can create VPC
without is_default flag. And at the end it can set the flag.
First thread will pass this. And second thread will fail at flag set
operation and will revert all created object. Then second thread
can check presence of default VPC again.
This way is better cause it can work across several controllers.

Change-Id: I5586fa234257b72721e328a9fa2375a56d1553c2

commit_message:
synchronize default vpc creation across threads

when two clients come for functions where check_default_vpc
is present then one goes to create default vpc and other fails.
it fails because vpc with is_default flag is already in DB
but children objects (like subnets) are not yet created.
For we will lock check_default_vpc function.

Another way is to rework _create_vpc. It can create VPC
without is_default flag. And at the end it can set the flag.
First thread will pass this. And second thread will fail at flag set
operation and will revert all created object. Then second thread
can check presence of default VPC again.
This way is better cause it can work across several controllers.

Change-Id: I5586fa234257b72721e328a9fa2375a56d1553c2

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-29 17:52:07.000000000', 'message': 'Update repo_build role for PBR fix

A new version of PBR was released which causes some services, like
gnocchi, to break in new and exciting ways. This change installs PBR
within the repo_build role which will ensure all of the correct tools
are available to the repo build process and are installed using known
constraints.

Change-Id: Ic21bf2ef50836f793d3c3549f2400ac05c6f751a
'}]
commit_message:
Update repo_build role for PBR fix

A new version of PBR was released which causes some services, like
gnocchi, to break in new and exciting ways. This change installs PBR
within the repo_build role which will ensure all of the correct tools
are available to the repo build process and are installed using known
constraints.

Change-Id: Ic21bf2ef50836f793d3c3549f2400ac05c6f751a

commit_message:
Add aggregates list to Destination object

This adds aggregates as a list of aggregate identifiers to Destination,
and also makes obj_load_attr() set the defaults, like RequestSpec for
convenience.

Related to blueprint placement-req-filter

Change-Id: If3d9e8da520489b8533ee0c76f02af0f9bbb32c7

commit_message:
Cleanup test-requirements

python-subunit is not used directly anywhere
and it is dependency of both testrepository
and os-testr
(probably was used by some tox wrapper script before)

Change-Id: Iab59ec5e933ac8d23f8844f598f39aeb5040bb70

This adds a pre-placement step where we can call a number of modular
"request filters" to modify the request_spec before we move on to
construct the call to placement to get allocation candidates.

It also adds the first such filter, which provides a way to limit/map
tenants to aggregates.

Related to blueprint placement-req-filter

commit_message:
Add request filter functionality to scheduler

This adds a pre-placement step where we can call a number of modular
"request filters" to modify the request_spec before we move on to
construct the call to placement to get allocation candidates.

No filters are added at this time, this just adds the infrastructure.

Related to blueprint placement-req-filter

Change-Id: I1535158a0dbd4a8527bb987e085e9391e5b0fde4

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-29 16:51:15.000000000', 'message': 'Remove ACL dance from the process

Remove steps in the release process around creating
temporary ACLs for new stable branches and switching
Gerrit group contents around release time.

This implements the plan presented and discussed at:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128731.html

Change-Id: I2d211af54dc4f170172757a82dc1e6c55d2ab504
'}]
commit_message:
Remove ACL dance from the process

Remove steps in the release process around creating
temporary ACLs for new stable branches and switching
Gerrit group contents around release time.

This implements the plan presented and discussed at:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128731.html

Change-Id: I2d211af54dc4f170172757a82dc1e6c55d2ab504

[{'created': '2018-03-29 14:43:42.000000000', 'message': 'vmware: Fixes _detach_instance_volumes method

The _detach_instance_volumes method calls self.detach_volume with an
invalid number of arguments (context missing), causing it to fail.
This patch solves the issue.

(cherry-picked from commit ad4a26e1843bc4cefa2c5b4bb093d692cddfaa49)

Change-Id: Ibb6afa883c4ed55ea544a1e9d247dab4fc657cd2
Closes-Bug: #1759609
'}]
commit_message:
vmware: Fixes _detach_instance_volumes method

The _detach_instance_volumes method calls self.detach_volume with an
invalid number of arguments (context missing), causing it to fail.
This patch solves the issue.

(cherry-picked from commit ad4a26e1843bc4cefa2c5b4bb093d692cddfaa49)

Change-Id: Ibb6afa883c4ed55ea544a1e9d247dab4fc657cd2
Closes-Bug: #1759609

commit_message:
Add an index on aggregate_metadata.value

We need this for the subsequent request_filter, which will do queries
based only on metadata value.

Related to blueprint placement-req-filter

Change-Id: I1325a226823329384edd7197e5d5f2725dc16e8f

commit_message:
Apt-cacher-ng's default ubuntu mirror list has faulty mirrors

The top mirror(http://mirror.veracruz.co/ubuntu/) is currently broken.
We can override the defaults by editing the override file
(/etc/apt-cacher-ng/backends_ubuntu) with valid mirrors.

Change-Id: I35f7efa665030282c9630d7423413e8bd3628ba5
Closes-Bug: 1759903

commit_message:
Make get_allocation_candidates() honor aggregate restrictions

This uses the member_of query parameter to placement to ensure that the
candidates returned are within the appropriate aggregate(s) if so
specified.

Related to blueprint placement-req-filter

Change-Id: If8ac06039ac9d647efdc088fbe944938e205e941

commit_message:
release openstackdocstheme 1.20.1

This release fixes an issue with projects that use eventlet and include
API documentation in their builds.

Change-Id: I4dc9b2a9926131ad71231c7fc748300d27a5df84
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
RBAC test for Keystone v3 OS-ENDPOINT-POLICY API

Added RBAC test cases to verify access permission for endpoint to policy
and service to policy association API. Actions covered here include put,
get and delete.

Co-Authored-By: Felipe Monteiro <felipe.monteiro@att.com>

Depends-On: I4af1e4862a17216d65446e8c29bd1b886f5d8c24
Change-Id: Ib268ab8b6b4800f66359d9fee3b3291ff651e095

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-26 14:04:01.000000000', 'message': 'Remove the os-net-config element config.json template

On upgrade from environments earlier than Pike we should remove
this file as it can cause problems with post-upgrade reboots
see bug for more info.

Change-Id: If7f4bef3a79a881f003ee42f62fe51c537004e2a
Closes-Bug: TODO(marios) https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1559151
'}, {'created': '2018-03-26 14:42:14.000000000', 'message': 'Remove the os-net-config element config.json template

this file as it can cause problems with post-upgrade reboots
see bug for more info.

Change-Id: If7f4bef3a79a881f003ee42f62fe51c537004e2a
Related-Bug: 1758161
'}]
commit_message:
Remove the os-net-config element config.json template

On upgrade from environments earlier than Pike we should remove
this file as it can cause problems with post-upgrade reboots
see bug for more info.

Change-Id: If7f4bef3a79a881f003ee42f62fe51c537004e2a
Related-Bug: 1758161

commit_message:
Use generic user for both zuul v2 and v3

Zuul v2 uses 'jenkins' as user, but Zuul v3 uses 'zuul'.
Using $USER solves it for both cases.

Change-Id: Id512c7b6a6c37128cfd6700473426b9fa56b36bb
(cherry picked from commit 30d88665982c043c4abbea4325c2842a8395203a)

commit_message:
Remove auth_host, auth_port, auth_protocol, and auth_version options

... in favor of just specifying an auth_uri (which *must* include a
version).

Note that this breaks from swift3, which needed to work with old configs
where version wasn't baked into the auth_uri.

Change-Id: Ie6af5764165adf69250373cd5f131bb140de13bc

commit_message:
[Docs] Change heading in target hosts

This brings consistency between target hosts configuration and
deploy host configuration, to be easier to read.

(cherry picked from commit c49b5efa663703417fdabff9742caf48ec94b0d9)

commit_message:
[Docs] Fix docs for latest openstackdocstheme

The latest openstackdocs theme is now providing defaults for
project name, version. We shouldn't ship this in our code.

Change-Id: I7943b5bae40515d260be21edd82284e9638880b0

commit_message:
Nagios Chart

This adds the nagios chart to osh-infra to provide additional
monitoring functionality. It uses helper functions to consume
yaml definitions for services, commands, hosts and hostgroups
to generate the required configurations for those entities in
nagios's configuration

Change-Id: I6238bb8cb1e5c8dc48594ddea50693f3e7b0a176

[{'created': '2018-03-29 16:33:01.000000000', 'message': "Install PBR to ensure we're not breaking builds

A new version of PBR was released which causes some services, like
gnocchi, to break in new and exciting ways. This change installs PBR
within the repo_build role which will ensure all of the correct tools
are available to the repo build process and are installed using known
constraints.

Change-Id: Ibf5e3bf0381ec40b1adbe6ce49a5cf7284d3e147
(cherry picked from commit 0e50a282b09f62670494ada2f7d42509c148067f)

"}]
commit_message:
Install PBR to ensure we're not breaking builds

A new version of PBR was released which causes some services, like
gnocchi, to break in new and exciting ways. This change installs PBR
within the repo_build role which will ensure all of the correct tools
are available to the repo build process and are installed using known
constraints.

Change-Id: Ibf5e3bf0381ec40b1adbe6ce49a5cf7284d3e147
(cherry picked from commit 0e50a282b09f62670494ada2f7d42509c148067f)
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-12 13:55:00.000000000', 'message': "Validate instance_info.traits against node traits

The ironic node traits spec calls out that traits added to
instance_info.traits should be validated against the node's traits.
All traits in instance_info.traits should exist in the node's traits.
This protects us against race conditions between traits being removed
from a node in ironic, and the node's resource provider's traits being
updated in placement. This change adds validation to update_node() in
the conductor manager, ensuring that all instance traits are also node
traits.

Further to this, we ensure that traits in instance info cannot be
removed from the node's trait list. This ensures that at all times,
the traits in node.instance_info.traits are a subset of traits in
node.traits.

Change-Id: I956f8285fe428b2bdf8822e4a308f5c2a1675836
Partial-Bug: #1722194
"}, {'created': '2018-02-13 19:27:19.000000000', 'message': "Validate instance_info.traits against node traits

The ironic node traits spec calls out that traits added to
instance_info.traits should be validated against the node's traits.
All traits in instance_info.traits should exist in the node's traits.
This protects us against race conditions between traits being removed
from a node in ironic, and the node's resource provider's traits being
updated in placement. This change adds validation to update_node() in
the conductor manager, ensuring that all instance traits are also node
traits.

Further to this, we ensure that traits in instance info cannot be
removed from the node's trait list. This ensures that at all times,
the traits in node.instance_info.traits are a subset of traits in
node.traits.

Finally, we check instance_info.traits in do_node_deploy(), in case the
check was not performed previously.

Change-Id: I956f8285fe428b2bdf8822e4a308f5c2a1675836
Partial-Bug: #1722194
"}, {'created': '2018-02-19 20:34:53.000000000', 'message': "Validate instance_info.traits against node traits

in placement. This change adds validation to do_node_deploy() in the
conductor manager, ensuring that all instance traits are also node
traits.

Change-Id: I956f8285fe428b2bdf8822e4a308f5c2a1675836
Partial-Bug: #1722194

commit_message:
Validate instance_info.traits against node traits

The ironic node traits spec calls out that traits added to
instance_info.traits should be validated against the node's traits.  All
traits in instance_info.traits should exist in the node's traits.  This
protects us against race conditions between traits being removed from a
node in ironic, and the node's resource provider's traits being updated
in placement.

This change adds validation to do_node_deploy() and
validate_driver_interfaces() in the conductor manager, ensuring that all
instance traits are also node traits.

Change-Id: I956f8285fe428b2bdf8822e4a308f5c2a1675836
Closes-Bug: #1755146
Related-Bug: #1722194

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-22 22:56:21.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure mysqld restart when config file changes

Since commit 1373073fd2ae6cfc4d1fb6c6a2c0e1b9f9550f04 the
percona-cluster charm has not been restarting mysqld after it has been
seeded even if the configuration file changed. This means that a post
deploy configuration change has no effect.

This change guarantees mysqld is restarted when the configuration file
changes. It required a redesign of the cluster build process.

Closes-Bug: #1756928
Change-Id: I0742e6889b32201806cec6a0b5835e11a8027567
'}, {'created': '2018-03-23 18:09:03.000000000', 'message': 'Redesign cluster buildup process

In order to fix bug#1756928 the whole cluster buildup process needed to
be redesigned. The assumptions about what is_bootstrapped and clustered
meant and when to restart on configuration changed needed to be
re-evaluated.

The timing of restarts needed to be protected to avoid collisions. And
the leader node must not continually restart on peer addition until the
cluster is complete.

This change guarantees mysqld is restarted when the configuration file
changes and meets all the above requirements.

Please merge charm-helpers fix first:
https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/138

Closes-Bug: #1756928
Change-Id: I0742e6889b32201806cec6a0b5835e11a8027567
'}, {'created': '2018-03-23 22:18:37.000000000', 'message': 'Redesign cluster buildup process

In order to fix bug#1756928 the whole cluster buildup process needed to
be redesigned. The assumptions about what is_bootstrapped and clustered
meant and when to restart on configuration changed needed to be
re-evaluated.

The timing of restarts needed to be protected to avoid collisions.
Only bootstrapped hosts should go in to the
wsrep_cluster_address=gcomm:// setting. Adding or removing units should
be handled gracefully. Starting with a single unit and expanding to a
cluster must work.

This change guarantees mysqld is restarted when the configuration file
changes and meets all the above requirements. As a consequence of the redesign,
the workload status now more accurately reflects the state of the unit.

Please merge charm-helpers fix first:
https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/138

Closes-Bug: #1756308
Closes-Bug: #1756928
Change-Id: I0742e6889b32201806cec6a0b5835e11a8027567

commit_message:
Redesign cluster buildup process

In order to fix bug#1756928 the whole cluster buildup process needed to
be redesigned. The assumptions about what is_bootstrapped and clustered
meant and when to restart on configuration changed needed to be
re-evaluated.

The timing of restarts needed to be protected to avoid collisions.
Only bootstrapped hosts should go in to the
wsrep_cluster_address=gcomm:// setting. Adding or removing units should
be handled gracefully. Starting with a single unit and expanding to a
cluster must work.

This change guarantees mysqld is restarted when the configuration file
changes and meets all the above requirements. As a consequence of the redesign,
the workload status now more accurately reflects the state of the unit.

Charm-helpers sync to bring in distributed_wait fix.

Closes-Bug: #1756308
Closes-Bug: #1756928
Change-Id: I0742e6889b32201806cec6a0b5835e11a8027567

commit_message:
Release python-openstackclient 3.12.1 (stable/pike)

Contains fixes for the following bugs:
- Remove hard-coded policy choices for creating a server group (bug 1732938)
- Neutron agent delete: remove the wrong argument (bug 1711301)
- Fix 'project purge' deletes ALL images problem (bug 1717130)

Change-Id: I90ab098efb1b39b834aa55c8f27f99453da6d311

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-12 15:43:09.000000000', 'message': 'Convert role to use a common systemd init role

This removes the systemd service templates and tasks from this role and
leverages a common systemd service role instead. This change removes a
lot of code duplication across all roles all without sacrificing features
or functionality. The intention of this change is to ensure uniformity and
reduce the maintenance burden on the community when sweeping changes are
needed. The exterior role is built to be OSA compatible and may be pulled
into tree should we deem it necessary.

commit_message:
Convert role to use a common systemd service role

This removes the systemd service templates and tasks from this role and
leverages a common systemd service role instead. This change removes a
lot of code duplication across all roles all without sacrificing features
or functionality. The intention of this change is to ensure uniformity and
reduce the maintenance burden on the community when sweeping changes are
needed.

Change-Id: I47287ce0deb45538894bd99e57c291c3ae7fa084
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Install PBR to ensure we're not breaking builds

A new version of PBR was released which causes some services, like
gnocchi, to break in new and exciting ways. This change installs PBR
within the repo_build role which will ensure all of the correct tools
are available to the repo build process and are installed using known
constraints.

Change-Id: Ibf5e3bf0381ec40b1adbe6ce49a5cf7284d3e147
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit b7aa8d4eef0061d6238822a6d7d64fa2659a95b3)

are published to pip, we don't need to use developer mode
for our tests. Given that we're not really in a position
to closely track every move the QA team makes, perhaps it
makes better sense for us to just used the released versions
for our tests so that we only have to deal with those changes

commit_message:
[TEST] Disable developer mode for tempest

Given that tempest is in upper-constraints and its releases
are published to pip, we don't need to use developer mode
for our tests. Given that we're not really in a position
to closely track every move the QA team makes, perhaps it
makes better sense for us to just used the released versions
for our tests so that we only have to deal with those changes
whenever they release, implying the confidence that they have
completed their implementation changes.

Change-Id: I0aa849eae62e37fc3c93a20c64e1627aeb5e0088

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-23 20:06:22.000000000', 'message': "Move _make_instance_list call outside of DB transaction context

The _make_instance_list method is used to make an InstanceList object
out of database dict-like instance objects. It's possible while making
the list that the various _from_db_object methods that are called might
do their own database writes.

Currently, we're calling _make_instance_list nested inside of a 'reader'
database transaction context and we hit the error:

  TypeError: Can't upgrade a READER transaction to a WRITER
  mid-transaction

during the _make_instance_list call if anything tries to do a database
write. The scenario encountered was after an upgrade to Pike, older
service records without UUIDs were attempted to be updated with UUIDs
upon access, and that access happened to be during an instance list,
so it failed when trying to write the service UUID while nested inside
the 'reader' database transaction context.

This simply moves the _make_instance_list method call out from the
@db.select_db_reader_mode decorated _get_by_filters_impl method to the
get_by_filters method to remove the nesting.

Closes-Bug: #1746509

Change-Id: Ifadf408802cc15eb9769d2dc1fc920426bb7fc20
(cherry picked from commit b1ed92c7af01a9ac7e122a541ce1bdb9be0524c4)
(cherry picked from commit 22b2a8e4645e15990a0f130a8866746497c5b5ee)
"}]
commit_message:
Move _make_instance_list call outside of DB transaction context

The _make_instance_list method is used to make an InstanceList object
out of database dict-like instance objects. It's possible while making
the list that the various _from_db_object methods that are called might
do their own database writes.

Currently, we're calling _make_instance_list nested inside of a 'reader'
database transaction context and we hit the error:

  TypeError: Can't upgrade a READER transaction to a WRITER
  mid-transaction

during the _make_instance_list call if anything tries to do a database
write. The scenario encountered was after an upgrade to Pike, older
service records without UUIDs were attempted to be updated with UUIDs
upon access, and that access happened to be during an instance list,
so it failed when trying to write the service UUID while nested inside
the 'reader' database transaction context.

This simply moves the _make_instance_list method call out from the
@db.select_db_reader_mode decorated _get_by_filters_impl method to the
get_by_filters method to remove the nesting.

Closes-Bug: #1746509

Change-Id: Ifadf408802cc15eb9769d2dc1fc920426bb7fc20
(cherry picked from commit b1ed92c7af01a9ac7e122a541ce1bdb9be0524c4)
(cherry picked from commit 22b2a8e4645e15990a0f130a8866746497c5b5ee)

commit_message:
Save admin password to sysmeta in libvirt driver

We have an API for setting the admin password for an already created
instance and we have a metadata API for retrieving the encrypted
password. In the libvirt driver, when a request to set the admin
password is received, it is indeed set in the guest but the instance
system metadata is never updated with the encrypted password, so
attempts to retrieve the password via the metadata service API result
in an empty string returned instead of the encrypted password.

This has been broken in the libvirt driver since the set admin password
password feature was added, as far as I can tell. The xen api driver,
however, handles the same thing correctly and this adds similar logic
to the libvirt driver to fix the problem.

Closes-Bug: #1748544

Change-Id: Icf44c4c94529cb75232abe1f3ecc5a4d3646b0cc
(cherry picked from commit 715a3cadb07fb92cc11542cfb5001844122b6f60)
(cherry picked from commit 6ed7fc11459eb5a69088630e5ea4d12e441f80f2)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-16 13:41:09.000000000', 'message': 'synchronize default vpc creation across threads

when two clients come for functions where check_default_vpc
is present then one goes to create default vpc and other fails.
it fails because vpc with is_default flag is already in DB
but children objects (like subnets) are not yet created.
For we will lock check_default_vpc function.

Another way is to rework _create_vpc. It can create VPC
without is_default flag. And at the end it can set the flag.
First thread will pass this. And second thread will fail at flag set
operation and will revert all created object. Then second thread
can check presence of default VPC again.
This way is better cause it can work across several controllers.

Change-Id: I5586fa234257b72721e328a9fa2375a56d1553c2

commit_message:
synchronize default vpc creation across threads

when two clients come for functions where check_default_vpc
is present then one goes to create default vpc and other fails.
it fails because vpc with is_default flag is already in DB
but children objects (like subnets) are not yet created.
For we will lock check_default_vpc function.

Another way is to rework _create_vpc. It can create VPC
without is_default flag. And at the end it can set the flag.
First thread will pass this. And second thread will fail at flag set
operation and will revert all created object. Then second thread
can check presence of default VPC again.
This way is better cause it can work across several controllers.

Change-Id: I5586fa234257b72721e328a9fa2375a56d1553c2

commit_message:
vmware: Fixes _detach_instance_volumes method

The _detach_instance_volumes method calls self.detach_volume with an
invalid number of arguments (context missing), causing it to fail.
This patch solves the issue.

Change-Id: Ibb6afa883c4ed55ea544a1e9d247dab4fc657cd2
Closes-Bug: #1759609

commit_message:
Move two more generic network utilities to a move obvious place.

This started as moving create_veth_pair, but it has dragged its
friend set_device_mtu with it because otherwise I end up with a
circular import.

Change-Id: I9872056c440a706b89dd51d3b9f2418951723efa

[{'created': '2018-03-28 22:52:30.000000000', 'message': "Start untangling network utilities.

The nova-net code contains a set of network utilities that are more
generally useful than nova-net, and that are called from a variety
of places in the nova code. Start separating those out into a utility
module so its clearer that they're not in fact part of nova-net and
should survive past the removal of nova-net.

We start with device_exists, because it is the first one I noticed.

Change-Id: Ieac8621217c42f8b2d08dbc58c2025262f325e1e
blueprint: remove-nova-network
"}]
commit_message:
Start untangling network utilities.

The nova-net code contains a set of network utilities that are more
generally useful than nova-net, and that are called from a variety
of places in the nova code. Start separating those out into a utility
module so its clearer that they're not in fact part of nova-net and
should survive past the removal of nova-net.

We start with device_exists, because it is the first one I noticed.

Change-Id: Ieac8621217c42f8b2d08dbc58c2025262f325e1e
blueprint: remove-nova-network

Having the VIF details that would be configured on the instance

commit_message:
VMware: add log message for VIF info details

Enhance debug logs to help troubleshoot networking issues.
Having the VIF details that would be configured on the instance
would make troubleshooting alot easier.

Change-Id: I7b0307c925155d541585fc1b19343398567eaa44

[{'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-03-22 18:26:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-03-22 18:34:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-03-28 17:44:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Any hints on how to proceed?

Could not satisfy constraints for 'horizon': installation from path or url cannot be constrained to a version
http://logs.openstack.org/08/555408/1/check/openstack-tox-lower-constraints/0149515/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-03-22_18_49_14_906896"}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-03-29 02:37:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-03-29 02:37:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Any hints on how to proceed?

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I44faa4c9391cf94788a839557b6386bc6737781f

A new version of PBR was released which causes some services, like
gnocchi, to break in new and exciting ways. This change installs PBR
within the repo_build role which will ensure all of the correct tools

Change-Id: Ibf5e3bf0381ec40b1adbe6ce49a5cf7284d3e147

commit_message:
Install PBR to ensure we're not breaking builds

A new version of PBR was released which causes some services, like
gnocchi, to break in new and exciting ways. This change installs PBR
within the repo_build role which will ensure all of the correct tools
are available to the repo build process and are installed using known
constraints.

Change-Id: Ibf5e3bf0381ec40b1adbe6ce49a5cf7284d3e147
(cherry picked from commit 0e50a282b09f62670494ada2f7d42509c148067f)
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

subject: Resolve race in providing deployment data to Swift
messages: [{'account_id': 7385, 'date': '2018-03-28 12:00:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2018-03-28 12:31:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-03-28 13:44:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\nrecheck'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-03-29 14:07:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 7385, 'date': '2018-03-29 14:42:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-03-29 15:00:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-28 12:00:34.000000000', 'message': "Resolve race in providing deployment data to Swift

While we are careful to ensure there are no race conditions in updating
the software deployment metadata in the Heat database, there was no such
protection in place for the actual update of the metadata provided to
the server via Swift. In legacy Heat, this race could only occur when
software deployments were created from the REST API or from separate
stacks deploying software to the same server, because resources in the
same stack were handled by a single thread making synchronous calls to
create the software deployments. However, with convergence, resources in
the same stack not only can be processed concurrently but will tend to
be synchronised if they have the same dependencies (since they'll be
triggered by consecutive asynchronous RPC messages).

This handles the race by retrying if a concurrent update is detected by
the time the data has been provided to Swift.

Note that this is only guaranteed to result in the latest data being
available on the assumption that a later write to Swift cannot overwrite
an earlier one that has been accepted. This is probably *not* guaranteed
by Swift in the presence of clock skew. Nonetheless, this should
drastically reduce the failure rate.

Similar caveats would probably apply to Zaqar, although Zaqar nominally
provides FIFO queues (in practice, it likely depends on the backend
used). However, with Zaqar clients receive all updates, not just the
latest one, and os-collect-config stores the deployments contained in
every message. Thus, Zaqar is not affected even assuming out-of-order
arrival.

Change-Id: Ic9a447f27e8c51f91f47f93b0fd1e9710341ec38
Closes-Bug: #1731032
(cherry picked from commit 46132999c016ed44972b9ac87a53946e9d8a7111)
"}, {'created': '2018-03-29 14:42:03.000000000', 'message': "Resolve race in providing deployment data to Swift

While we are careful to ensure there are no race conditions in updating
the software deployment metadata in the Heat database, there was no such
protection in place for the actual update of the metadata provided to
the server via Swift. In legacy Heat, this race could only occur when
software deployments were created from the REST API or from separate
stacks deploying software to the same server, because resources in the
same stack were handled by a single thread making synchronous calls to
create the software deployments. However, with convergence, resources in
the same stack not only can be processed concurrently but will tend to
be synchronised if they have the same dependencies (since they'll be
triggered by consecutive asynchronous RPC messages).

This handles the race by retrying if a concurrent update is detected by
the time the data has been provided to Swift.

Note that this is only guaranteed to result in the latest data being
available on the assumption that a later write to Swift cannot overwrite
an earlier one that has been accepted. This is probably *not* guaranteed
by Swift in the presence of clock skew. Nonetheless, this should
drastically reduce the failure rate.

Similar caveats would probably apply to Zaqar, although Zaqar nominally
provides FIFO queues (in practice, it likely depends on the backend
used). However, with Zaqar clients receive all updates, not just the
latest one, and os-collect-config stores the deployments contained in
every message. Thus, Zaqar is not affected even assuming out-of-order
arrival.

Change-Id: Ic9a447f27e8c51f91f47f93b0fd1e9710341ec38
Closes-Bug: #1731032
(cherry picked from commit 46132999c016ed44972b9ac87a53946e9d8a7111)
"}]
commit_message:
Resolve race in providing deployment data to Swift

While we are careful to ensure there are no race conditions in updating
the software deployment metadata in the Heat database, there was no such
protection in place for the actual update of the metadata provided to
the server via Swift. In legacy Heat, this race could only occur when
software deployments were created from the REST API or from separate
stacks deploying software to the same server, because resources in the
same stack were handled by a single thread making synchronous calls to
create the software deployments. However, with convergence, resources in
the same stack not only can be processed concurrently but will tend to
be synchronised if they have the same dependencies (since they'll be
triggered by consecutive asynchronous RPC messages).

This handles the race by retrying if a concurrent update is detected by
the time the data has been provided to Swift.

Note that this is only guaranteed to result in the latest data being
available on the assumption that a later write to Swift cannot overwrite
an earlier one that has been accepted. This is probably *not* guaranteed
by Swift in the presence of clock skew. Nonetheless, this should
drastically reduce the failure rate.

Similar caveats would probably apply to Zaqar, although Zaqar nominally
provides FIFO queues (in practice, it likely depends on the backend
used). However, with Zaqar clients receive all updates, not just the
latest one, and os-collect-config stores the deployments contained in
every message. Thus, Zaqar is not affected even assuming out-of-order
arrival.

Change-Id: Ic9a447f27e8c51f91f47f93b0fd1e9710341ec38
Closes-Bug: #1731032
(cherry picked from commit 46132999c016ed44972b9ac87a53946e9d8a7111)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-27 16:34:29.000000000', 'message': '[www-index] Splits Releases and Languages items

It has not been easy to select language pages on
"More Releases & Languages" dropdown list since
there are many releases (currently, 18).

This patch splits into "More Releases" and "Languages"
dropdown lists by:
- Changing from 9 to 8 for col-lg/md/sm-* in the left part
- Allocating 2 for col-lg/md/sm-* in each dropdown list
- Removing unnecessary dropdown-header part
- Changing on dropdown-menu width from 100% to 150%
  since original "More Releases & Languages" was allocated
  as 3 and the number 3 was changed to 2.

Change-Id: I4fd1c345dfd3debd14167839c1b93c69a3d3027e
'}]
commit_message:
[www-index] Splits Releases and Languages items

It has not been easy to select language pages on
"More Releases & Languages" dropdown list since
there are many releases (currently, 18).

This patch splits into "More Releases" and "Languages"
dropdown lists by:
- Changing from 9 to 8 for col-lg/md/sm-* in the left part
- Allocating 2 for col-lg/md/sm-* in each dropdown list
- Removing unnecessary dropdown-header part
- Changing on dropdown-menu width from 100% to 150%
  since original "More Releases & Languages" was allocated
  as 3 and the number 3 was changed to 2.

Change-Id: I4fd1c345dfd3debd14167839c1b93c69a3d3027e

commit_message:
Use ALIAS instead of LABEL for BGPVPN API

ALIAS stopped being relevant and will be removed from neutron-lib, in
favor of LABEL.

This patch replaces one for the other.

For more details see https://review.openstack.org/557691/

Change-Id: I96876caaba1e2663eb0451335327cb1276420d4f

messages:
[{'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-01-11 13:31:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-01-11 13:43:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)

Nice start. Didn't get all the way through, but left a few comments. Good to see this happening."}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-01-11 14:02:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-01-11 17:13:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(5 comments)

Looks really good, a few minor things in-line, and thoughts/comments.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-01-15 10:33:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

(5 comments)

Trying to clarify. I'm still not in favor of using the negotiated latest without the upper cap."}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-01-15 10:36:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-01-15 10:46:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 1063, 'date': '2018-01-15 17:30:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I like this approach in general, but I'm not very comfortable with the emphasis on the low-level SDKs. Ideally, an SDK should expose behaviors, not microversions. If a later microversion enables a cat to bark, the SDK should expose a cat.bark() method to the consumer, and handle the necessary microversion parameters without requiring the user to know what version is needed. I do agree that if the SDK is used against an older cloud that hasn't yet upgraded to a version of the cat service that supports bark(), it should indicate that early on so that the consumer can code around that possibility."}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-01-18 12:56:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> If a later microversion enables a cat to bark, the SDK should expose a cat.bark() method to the consumer, and handle the necessary microversion parameters without requiring the user to know what version is needed.

This is what I call a high-level SDK, yes. And we should write moar of them :) However, I cannot provide a lot of guidance of them, because their models can vary.

On the other hand, we have the problem of python-XXXclient (in our case XXX == ironic), which are historically quite tiny wrappers around the actual API. I would argue that such things should exist as well - for example, for those building their own high-level SDKs.

Also, the meow()/bark() example is a bit oversimplified. Let's imagine a new field added to Ironic's Node model. A high-level SDK will expose it only when its own Node model gets update. For things like ironicclient (and our OSC plugin based on it) we may want it to be available when it's available from the server.

So, the outcome of this discussion may be "Let's stop writing low-level SDKs", but I'm not sure the OpenStack world is ready for it ;)'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-01-18 17:28:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-01-18 18:33:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-01-22 12:02:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-01-22 12:05:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 1063, 'date': '2018-01-22 23:22:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2018-01-24 16:53:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(15 comments)

Thanks for the guidelines Dmitry. Lots to think about (and I don't think I understood some of it)."}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-01-25 16:28:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(11 comments)

Updating while working from train, please pardon any typos :)'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-01-25 16:45:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-01-31 14:17:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(6 comments)

Good detail, but after a while I started thinking "If I'm an SDK writer I'm going to either write a high level SDK or I'm going to go do something else, these low level ones are crazy".

So that made me think: who is the audience of this document and what is it that we want them to be able to achieve as a result of reading this? We seem to be giving them a lot of rules, but I'm not sure there's sufficient encouragement.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-03-15 14:57:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 1063, 'date': '2018-03-20 16:40:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1

I think you've addressed the major concerns reviewers have expressed. I think we can merge this, and address any lingering issues in a follow-up patch."}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-03-21 13:04:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1

(2 comments)

Some nits within, but I agree with Ed that we can merge^wfreeze this for wider review, then merge it, and then iterate based on whatever we learn.'}, {'account_id': 1063, 'date': '2018-03-22 16:31:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2

Frozen for wider review by the community. If there are no objections, it will be merged in 1 week'}, {'account_id': 10670, 'date': '2018-03-22 19:46:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1

this seems really sensible and well thought out to me, thanks Dmitry'}, {'account_id': 8246, 'date': '2018-03-23 02:31:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-03-26 04:05:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1

(2 comments)

Generally looks good. Some comments inline, but the current version still sounds a good summary.'}, {'account_id': 1063, 'date': '2018-03-29 16:43:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Horizon: Move all config to be directly values driven.

This PS moves all the config files to be directly values driven,
both simplifying over-ride and allowing configs to be targeted
to pods in future work.

Change-Id: I7e16585c9ef49275327d19a48f00bad192dc4923

commit_message:
Cinder: Move all config to be directly values driven.

This PS moves all the config files to be directly values driven,
both simplifying over-ride and allowing configs to be targeted
to pods in future work.
