commit_message:
Stop systemd-resolve from booting on our images

It seems with ubuntu-bionic, systemd-resolve boots by default. This is
then overwriting our /etc/resolv.conf file with its nameserver
address.

Change-Id: I3de217505cc0ba18a233e8712be49c5347a8e29b
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I6fe59b462eb976a1291b23ac504912f8c76dbd35
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Install PBR to ensure we're not breaking builds

A new version of PBR was released which causes some services, like
gnocchi, to break in new and exciting ways. This change installs PBR
within the repo_build role which will ensure all of the correct tools
are available to the repo build process and are installed using known
constraints.

Change-Id: Ibf5e3bf0381ec40b1adbe6ce49a5cf7284d3e147
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Fix failure when adding a speaker to an agent

When get_bgp_speaker_with_advertised_routes() collects the data for BGP
peers, it needs to include the auth_type field, otherwise adding the
speaker to an agent will fail.

(cherry picked from commit fd497a491afec89d4a15cf061b5d5610fb7ad6d2)
Change-Id: I668397be4a531ba5c0628eb23df9a84d0de8c28c
Closes-Bug: 1750121

'}, {'created': '2018-02-02 01:24:38.000000000', 'message': "Fix devstack configuration for fwaas v2

We hit an error if you use neutron-legacy and enable 'neutron'
devstack plugin. [1] in devstack/settings in the neutron repo
overrides NEUTRON_CORE_PLUGIN_CONF_PATH defined in devstack
lib/neutron.

This is required to keep backward-compatibility as long as we
use neutron-legacy because NEUTRON_CORE_PLUGIN_CONF_PATH and
variables derived from it in neutron-legacy are assumed to
relative and used to access config files inside a repository.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/bc150cdbf8b3af040a61b5b85b0d725e5186ff13/devstack/settings#L8

Co-Authored-By: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I462af133ed8c34448f4ee8593a423b5f0b942da1
"}]
commit_message:
Fix devstack configuration for fwaas v2

We hit an error if you use neutron-legacy and enable 'neutron'
devstack plugin. [1] in devstack/settings in the neutron repo
overrides NEUTRON_CORE_PLUGIN_CONF_PATH defined in devstack
lib/neutron.

This is required to keep backward-compatibility as long as we
use neutron-legacy because NEUTRON_CORE_PLUGIN_CONF_PATH and
variables derived from it in neutron-legacy are assumed to
relative and used to access config files inside a repository.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/bc150cdbf8b3af040a61b5b85b0d725e5186ff13/devstack/settings#L8

Co-Authored-By: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I462af133ed8c34448f4ee8593a423b5f0b942da1

[{'created': '2018-03-29 06:48:04.000000000', 'message': 'add check before adding cpus to cpuset_reserved

There are some cases where None value is set to cpuset_reserved in
InstanceNUMATopology at _numa_fit_instance_cell() function in
hardware.py. However, libvirt driver treat cpuset_reserved value
as an iterate object when it constructs xml configuration.

To avoid a risk to get an error in libvirt driver, this patch adds
a check to see if the value is not None before adding the cpus
for emulator threads.

Conflicts:
        nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py

The conflict is due to f0620a01dee1cd98685ec04b3bdef09765cdff61

Change-Id: Iab3d950c4f4138118ac6a9fd98407eaadcb24d9e
Closes-Bug: #1746674
(cherry picked from commit 24d9e06ec68dfd0ead9bc56ad186e7b4e0acd8fb)

commit_message:
add check before adding cpus to cpuset_reserved

There are some cases where None value is set to cpuset_reserved in
InstanceNUMATopology at _numa_fit_instance_cell() function in
hardware.py. However, libvirt driver treat cpuset_reserved value
as an iterate object when it constructs xml configuration.

To avoid a risk to get an error in libvirt driver, this patch adds
a check to see if the value is not None before adding the cpus
for emulator threads.

Conflicts:
        nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py

The conflict is due to f0620a01dee1cd98685ec04b3bdef09765cdff61

Change-Id: Iab3d950c4f4138118ac6a9fd98407eaadcb24d9e
Closes-Bug: #1746674
(cherry picked from commit 24d9e06ec68dfd0ead9bc56ad186e7b4e0acd8fb)

commit_message:
Add sphinx_feature_classification as a requirement

This library allows sphinx docs to generate feature matrices. Projects
can now pull this code from a common library.

Change-Id: I3ecea5f6a8b8e6bcfbc34019a2d2652ada8c9c57

commit_message:
Move VMwareAPI virt driver codes to Nova repo

Currently, when we use OVSvApp VC driver,
we need to move OVSvApp codes into Nova repo manually.
This patch set moves them into Nova repo, and also
move config opts to nova/conf/vmware.py.

See:
https://github.com/openstack/networking-vsphere/blob/master/devstack/plugin.sh#L85-L86

commit_message:
Add disk_minimum_physical_free_space_ratio option to disk filter.

This setting allows us to tell the disk filter "Go ahead and
overcommit disk space, but please at least leave SOME empty space
for instance growth."

Default value is 0, which maintains the former behavior of
scheduling instances on a host with a 100% full drive if
disk_allocation_ratio > 1.0

Change-Id: Iaaecc0b728708c1e89edbd79feec75c842a205d3
Closes-Bug: #1513654

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-04-21 13:55:57.000000000', 'message': "numa: fix an uninitialized local variable

There are two issues: we refer to a variable which can be not
initialized. Normally we should never be in such situation but a race
condition highlighted that case.

The second one is that, currently the code is doing the right pinning
because we go through 'sibling_sets' (plural) in a reverse order. So
'sibling_set' (singular) when initialized is using the group of cores
with the smallest set of siblings: 1 to N.

This patch is fixing the issue by ensuring that singling_sets is not
empty and passing the group 1 to get the pinning.

Change-Id: I7ea0ecd4ef1436098863e0b3bf6f776fc495d4e3
Closes-bug: bug/1685226

commit_message:
numa: fix an uninitialized local variable

There are two issues: we refer to a variable which can be not
initialized. Normally we should never be in such situation but a race
condition highlighted that case.

The second one is that, currently the code is doing the right pinning
because we go through 'sibling_sets' (plural) in a reverse order. So
'sibling_set' (singular) when initialized is using the group of cores
with the smallest set of siblings: 1 to N.

This patch is fixing the issue by ensuring that sibling_sets is not
empty and passing the group 1 to get the pinning.

Change-Id: I7ea0ecd4ef1436098863e0b3bf6f776fc495d4e3
Closes-bug: #1685226

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-04-21 13:55:57.000000000', 'message': "numa: fix an uninitialized local variable

There are two issues: we refer to a variable which can be not
initialized. Normally we should never be in such situation but a race
condition highlighted that case.

The second one is that, currently the code is doing the right pinning
because we go through 'sibling_sets' (plural) in a reverse order. So
'sibling_set' (singular) when initialized is using the group of cores
with the smallest set of siblings: 1 to N.

This patch is fixing the issue by ensuring that singling_sets is not
empty and passing the group 1 to get the pinning.

Change-Id: I7ea0ecd4ef1436098863e0b3bf6f776fc495d4e3
Closes-bug: bug/1685226

commit_message:
numa: fix an uninitialized local variable

There are two issues: we refer to a variable which can be not
initialized. Normally we should never be in such situation but a race
condition highlighted that case.

The second one is that, currently the code is doing the right pinning
because we go through 'sibling_sets' (plural) in a reverse order. So
'sibling_set' (singular) when initialized is using the group of cores
with the smallest set of siblings: 1 to N.

This patch is fixing the issue by ensuring that sibling_sets is not
empty and passing the group 1 to get the pinning.

Change-Id: I7ea0ecd4ef1436098863e0b3bf6f776fc495d4e3
Closes-bug: #1685226

[{'created': '2017-04-29 15:09:29.000000000', 'message': "Related-Bug: 1680773
This adds a description to address the limitation of migrating servers
in a server group created with the 'affinity' policy.

Change-Id: Ica9a8159990c1cb69f3dd9a0ddc78e00c7c9d186

commit_message:
Related-Bug: 1680773
This adds a description to address the limitation of migrating servers
in a server group created with the 'affinity' policy.

Change-Id: Ica9a8159990c1cb69f3dd9a0ddc78e00c7c9d186

Sorry, I don't understand why this makes sense.

The API operations are all protected already by other policy file things. This is just about allowing flavor-rxtx at all, in any of those operations.

It is probably more consistent to just remove the policy check all together, now all API extensions are enabled by default. That would be my preference here."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-04-27 04:31:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Verified-1

> Sorry, I don't understand why this makes sense.
 > 
 > The API operations are all protected already by other policy file
 > things. This is just about allowing flavor-rxtx at all, in any of
 > those operations.
 > 
 > It is probably more consistent to just remove the policy check all
 > together, now all API extensions are enabled by default. That would
 > be my preference here.

The original concern was that the flavor-rxtx policy is only used in conjunction with flavor or flavor manage, but was much less restrictive (which didn't make sense to me or my team, at least). If removing this policy would be preferred, I'll do that in my next patch set."}, {'account_id': 23185, 'date': '2017-04-27 15:34:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-04-27 16:22:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Verified-1

I believe we should deprecate the policy, not just remove it.

I am happy to remove a policy without deprecation window if its not currently used in the code, but if its used we should have a deprecation window.

In my mind the discoverable was a special case because it only changed the behaviour of a deprecated API that people should no longer be using.

Agreed there is no good case for this policy to stay around, but we should give people a transition plan, I believe.'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2017-04-28 11:05:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

commit_message:
Deprecate flavor-rxtx policy

flavor-rxtx is used only by FlavorRxtx controller, which is to
be removed in a future release. This deprecates the flavor-rxtx
policy check, with plans to remove it in a future release.

Change-Id: Icf6d00c9e06e55fb2ba7a52acaf147217f793f5b
Closes-Bug: #1665739

commit_message:
Update help text for encryption provider

The volume encryption provider no longer uses class names.
Instead, 'luks' and 'plain' are used. This patch updates
the help text for the volume encryption provider to use
the new encryption provider format constants.

Change-Id: I2911098505a99658e04ac4008e5f3e857db81f95

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-28 16:02:26.000000000', 'message': 'vmware: log quality warning on startup

The VMware 3rd party CI has been, for the most part, for at
least the last couple of years, sporadic at best, but usually
non-existent or broken on the changes on which it does report.

Therefore we should log a quality warning on startup that
indicates its low level of testing compared to the other virt
drivers in Nova.

Change-Id: Ic13e39926dda045394c79c33169e81592df86a4e
'}]
commit_message:
vmware: log quality warning on startup

The VMware 3rd party CI has been, for the most part, for at
least the last couple of years, sporadic at best, but usually
non-existent or broken on the changes on which it does report.

Therefore we should log a quality warning on startup that
indicates its low level of testing compared to the other virt
drivers in Nova.

Change-Id: Ic13e39926dda045394c79c33169e81592df86a4e

commit_message:
Integrate oslo.config validator

Adds the oslo configuration file validator as a new entry point.

The config validator is a tool intended for use by operators to validate
their modified configuration files before standing up services in production.

Change-Id: I17f452d3aad58d406974133af93d97c9b8e10f0c
Depends-On: I78d3621afda226f5968963ef408507234dfead4c

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-07-26 08:24:03.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Delete ports created during port create timeout

Port create can timeout but still create a port. So we can't just track
the created port_uuids, we must attach the device id to the port,
so we can later go find those ports and delete them.

Change-Id: Ic8326425d3fbe16408a2d4725921d6bd03f1702e
Fixes-Bug: 1603909

"}, {'created': '2017-02-09 14:29:29.000000000', 'message': "Stop leaking ports on port_create timeout

Sometimes neutron can take a long time to create a port, as its an
expensive operation at the best of times, and sometimes it can take so
long that the HTTP request times out. Usually this timeout doesn't stop
the port from being created.

To avoid us leaking ports, we move to query neutron for the list of
ports that have the device_id set (this can only be the ones we have
created, at this point), and delete those. This will include the ports
that are created after the timeout succeeds.

Note: the fact the port_create times out, shouldn't mean the list ports
and delete ports calls will also timeout. Of course they could fail, but
we just log that error here. We need to look more generally at a more
careful clean up of resources like ports and volumes when there are
errors during the full lifecycle of the instance.

Closes-Bug: 1603909

Change-Id: Ic8326425d3fbe16408a2d4725921d6bd03f1702e
"}, {'created': '2017-02-09 14:33:01.000000000', 'message': "Stop leaking ports on port_create timeout

Sometimes neutron can take a long time to create a port, as its an
expensive operation at the best of times, and sometimes it can take so
long that the HTTP request times out. Usually this timeout doesn't stop
the port from being created.

To avoid us leaking ports, we move to query neutron for the list of
ports that have the device_id set (this can only be the ones we have
created, at this point), and delete those. This will include the ports
that are created after the timeout succeeds.

Note: the fact the port_create times out, shouldn't mean the list ports
and delete ports calls will also timeout. Of course they could fail, but
we just log that error here. We need to look more generally at a more
careful clean up of resources like ports and volumes when there are
errors during the full lifecycle of the instance.

commit_message:
Stop leaking ports on port_create timeout

Sometimes neutron can take a long time to create a port, as its an
expensive operation at the best of times, and sometimes it can take so
long that the HTTP request times out. Usually this timeout doesn't stop
the port from being created.

To avoid us leaking ports, we move to query neutron for the list of
ports that have the device_id set (this can only be the ones we have
created, at this point), and delete those. This will include the ports
that are created after the timeout succeeds.

Note: the fact the port_create times out, shouldn't mean the list ports
and delete ports calls will also timeout. Of course they could fail, but
we just log that error here. We need to look more generally at a more
careful clean up of resources like ports and volumes when there are
errors during the full lifecycle of the instance.

Closes-Bug: 1603909

Change-Id: Ic8326425d3fbe16408a2d4725921d6bd03f1702e

This seems odd - is the display name truly the same as the host name?'}, {'account_id': 15888, 'date': '2016-12-23 09:50:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

> This seems odd - is the display name truly the same as the host
 > name?

Hi, thanks for the review, the idea of this patch is that when we create the instance, the hostname is set to be the same as instance.name which is display name for seen by users, we even have an tempest test to ssh to the server to check the actual hostname, we might also update the host name when we update the instance name. what do you think?'}, {'account_id': 17922, 'date': '2017-01-05 02:40:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 15888, 'date': '2017-01-05 04:00:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2017-01-05 18:40:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

I think this change would need a spec and discussion around it. Initially, the hostname is created based on the display_name given at boot time, but after that the hostname is not changeable. There could be reasons it's kept static, such as the need to update DNS upon changing the hostname.

In the past, I've discussed some ideas around this, such as decoupling hostname from display_name and letting display_name be a "nickname" people can use to help identify instances. And let hostname be specified and changed separately.

Since hostname can't currently be changed, I think a spec and discussion are needed to add the feature.'}, {'account_id': 14511, 'date': '2017-02-01 21:25:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

Melanie made a good point. Changing the hostname seems to have too many effects than desired.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-03-29 15:36:33.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Update hostname of server when updating its name

Sync the hostname of server if updating name.

Co-Authored-By: Zhenyu Zheng <zhengzhenyu@huawei.com>

Change-Id: Iecda04696b863a7631c52ea6f7bd6060ddb972d9
Closes-Bug: #1645272

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html

    Chnages for bug 1613105

commit e88afc046b2ab833a307869d775b820252341612

While tracking this issue it is found that when nova api is called for the volume detach it is creating sync problem
So to do the proper cleanup I modified nova api to – glance api and it is resolving sync issue.
And cleanup procedure become smooth for the test cases.

Chnages for bug 1613105

'}, {'created': '2016-10-07 17:49:53.000000000', 'message': 'Resolving volume sync issue in from databases before deleting the volumes.

as per the expectation so the functional test cases are failing.  This problem is visible when nova api is used to detach the volume before
deleting the volume. In this scenarios it is creating sync problem !!So to do the proper cleanup I modified nova api to – glance api to resolving sync issue.
And cleanup procedure become smooth for the test cases.

This problem is in the functional test cases execution in scenarios like
Volume create --> Attach volume with instance --> Detach volume from instance --> Delete volume

commit_message:
Resolving volume sync issue before deleting the volumes.

Summary : It is found that after running the test cases(functional)
volumes were leaking and it is not detaching properly due to wrong
api calling as per the expectation so the functional test cases are
failing.  This problem is visible when nova api is used to detach
the volume before deleting the volume. In this scenarios it is
creating sync problem !!So to do the proper cleanup I added
cinder api along with the nova api for detach to resolving sync issue.

currently this is working as a work around solution once actual root cause is found
then this step will be removed

Problem is in the functional test cases execution in
Volume create --> Attach volume with instance
                   --> Detach volume from instance
                          --> Delete volume

Closes-bug: 1613105

Change-Id: Ie85779efeaa6ba11d4695aeb1f516264c75c0933

[{'account_id': 18851, 'date': '2018-03-27 00:25:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 18851, 'date': '2018-03-27 01:39:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 18851, 'date': '2018-03-27 01:40:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 18851, 'date': '2018-03-27 01:55:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 6133, 'date': '2018-03-27 08:52:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

How are we going to manage the skip-tags? See that at first step, when you do the controllers, you also need to do stack outputs/upgrade in all nodes. Then, when we do at the computes, we need to call skip-tags on stack outputs/upgrade, and just run upgrade_steps/deploy_steps. In all cases we need to skip ceph tasks, and do it after controller/computes are done. In my change, i was relying on adding that manually, on the commands, using ansible-args. But if you want to automate for CI, how are you going to achieve it?'}, {'account_id': 18851, 'date': '2018-03-27 13:09:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> How are we going to manage the skip-tags? See that at first step,
 > when you do the controllers, you also need to do stack
 > outputs/upgrade in all nodes. Then, when we do at the computes, we
 > need to call skip-tags on stack outputs/upgrade, and just run
 > upgrade_steps/deploy_steps. In all cases we need to skip ceph
 > tasks, and do it after controller/computes are done. In my change,
 > i was relying on adding that manually, on the commands, using
 > ansible-args. But if you want to automate for CI, how are you going
 > to achieve it?

The point is to not have to rely on skip tags to have the ability to upgrade the nodes per role. As you can see in fast-forward-upgrade/main.yml the stack outputs and the ffu upgrade playbook are common for both flows. Only after them there are boolean based includes for the different flows(bulk or per role). Ceph comes again in main.yml one of the 2 plays in includes have run.'}, {'account_id': 18851, 'date': '2018-03-27 15:54:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 18851, 'date': '2018-03-27 17:30:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 18851, 'date': '2018-03-27 18:12:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 18851, 'date': '2018-03-27 18:48:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 18851, 'date': '2018-03-27 19:10:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 18851, 'date': '2018-03-28 00:19:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 18851, 'date': '2018-03-28 00:21:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 18851, 'date': '2018-03-28 03:37:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2018-03-28 11:56:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

commit_message:
Add support for per role FFU upgrade

This change adds the option to run the FFU workflow in batches per
roles. The newly introduced workflow first updates the controller
role and then the compute role. In addition it enables running FFU
for compute nodes in a rolling fashion.

Change-Id: I996df8f149ffefe71b20a82cbc979cdc5b3dda11

'}, {'created': '2018-03-26 11:09:17.000000000', 'message': 'Work around packaging issue in iptables-services.

When iptables-services is upgraded it restarts the iptables which
breaks connectivity because it looses the current iptables rules.

So we add another network workaround.  This time around the
iptables-services package.

The first target is the update process as this is where the problem
should arise, but as the "framework" is already is place, we cover
upgrade as well.

Partial-Bug: #1758291

Change-Id: Ia2f94058bac6cf28b4bd425385ffd629555c9609
'}, {'created': '2018-03-28 11:22:08.000000000', 'message': 'Work around packaging issue in iptables-services.

When iptables-services is upgraded it restarts the iptables which
breaks connectivity because it looses the current iptables rules.

So we add another network workaround.  This time around the
iptables-services package.

The first target is the update process as this is where the problem
should arise, but as the "framework" is already is place, we cover
upgrade as well.

commit_message:
Work around packaging issue in iptables-services.

When iptables-services is upgraded it restarts the iptables services
which breaks connectivity because it looses the current iptables
rules.

So we add another network workaround.  This time around the
iptables-services package.

The first target is the update process as this is where the problem
should arise, but as the framework for network workaround is already
is place, we cover upgrade as well.

Partial-Bug: #1758291

Change-Id: Ia2f94058bac6cf28b4bd425385ffd629555c9609

commit_message:
deprecate older general configs

deprecate old general configurations

In order to better support the growing list of
supported configurations we need to prune out the
older less tested configurations in src

Configurations required should be documented and
listed in https://docs.openstack.org/tripleo-quickstart/latest/feature-configuration.html

Related-To: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/553892/
Change-Id: I3bd3eb6dfe6a8d769bc5110c43abfb5d76b9de31

commit_message:
Update 'share-pci-between-numa-nodes' spec to reflect reality

Upon implementation, the per-device configuration was deemed preferable
to adding yet more image metadata and flavor extra spec keys. Update the
spec to reflect this change.

Part of bp share-pci-between-numa-nodes

Change-Id: I503e0cd00325daa2f3286aad1e6a2beba7fc6cf9

commit_message:
Revert "Use a common python build/install role for source-base deployment"

This is causing some trouble with the integrated build. For now,
while we work out the role's build/storage delegation, let's revert
this.

This reverts commit 975675b65949042ea7dea108294f0604fb37fd10, except
for the a-r-r entry which is left in place as it will be needed later.

Change-Id: I111baaf1e3d70c036508cccc31887e0f328a67ce
